member.summary: Total number of lines.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.MaximumBidiReorderingDepth
member.summary: The maximum reordering count of any line of text, used to calculate the most number of hit-testing boxes needed. If the layout has no bidirectional text, or no text at all, the minimum level is 1.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.LayoutHeight
member.summary: Initial height given to the layout. Depending on the length of the text, it may be larger or smaller than the text content height.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.LayoutWidth
member.summary: The initial width given to the layout. It can be either larger or smaller than the text content width, depending on whether the text was wrapped.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.Height
member.summary: The height of the formatted text. The height of an empty string is set to the same value as that of the default font.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.WidthIncludingTrailingWhitespace
member.summary: The width of the formatted text, taking into account the trailing whitespace at the end of each line.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.Width
member.summary: A value that indicates the width of the formatted text, while ignoring trailing whitespace at the end of each line.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.Top
member.summary: A value that indicates the top-most point of formatted text relative to the layout box, while excluding any glyph overhang.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics.Left
member.summary: A value that indicates the left-most point of formatted text relative to the layout box, while excluding any glyph overhang.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextMetrics
member.summary: Contains the metrics associated with text after layout. All coordinates are in device independent pixels (DIPs).

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.Surface1.ReleaseDC
member.summary: Releases the GDI device context (DC) associated with the current surface and allows rendering using Direct3D.
member.returns: A object describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.Surface1.ReleaseDC(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Releases the GDI device context (DC) associated with the current surface and allows rendering using Direct3D.
member.param: A pointer to a rectangle that identifies the dirty region of the surface. A dirty region is any part of the surface that you have used for GDI rendering and that you want to preserve. This is used as a performance hint to graphics subsystem in certain scenarios. Do not use this parameter to restrict rendering to the specified rectangular region. The area specified by the rectangle will be used as a performance hint to indicate what areas have been manipulated by GDI rendering.
member.returns: A object describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.Surface1.GetDC(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a device context (DC) that allows you to render to a DXGI surface using GDI.
member.param: If true the application will not preserve any rendering with GDI; otherwise, false. If false, any previous rendering to the device context will be preserved. This flag is ideal for simply reading the device context and not doing any rendering to the surface.
member.returns: A pointer to an HDC handle that represents the current device context for GDI rendering.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The COM object implementing the IDXGISurface1 interface.

member.summary: Extends the standard surface interface to provide GDI interop support.

The destination texture.
One or more flags that control generation of normal maps.
One or more flag specifying the source of height information.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.KeyedMutex.Release(System.Int64)
member.summary: Using a key, releases exclusive rendering access to a shared resource.
member.param: A value that indicates which device to give access to. This method will succeed when the device that currently owns the surface calls the KeyedMutex.ReleaseSync method using the same value. This key can be any arbitrary value.
member.returns: A object describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.KeyedMutex.Acquire(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Using a key, acquires exclusive rendering access to a shared resource.
member.param: A value that indicates which device to give access to. This method will succeed when the device that currently owns the surface calls the KeyedMutex.Release method using the same value. This key can be any arbitrary value.

The time-out interval, in milliseconds. This method will return if the interval elapses, and the keyed mutex has not been released using the specified key. If this value is set to zero, the Acquire method will test to see if the keyed mutex has been released and returns immediately. If this value is set to the maximum integral value, the time-out interval will never elapse.
member.returns: A object describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DXGI.KeyedMutex.#ctor(SlimDX.IComObject)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The COM object implementing the IDXGIKeyedMutex interface.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DXGI.KeyedMutex
member.summary: Represents a keyed mutex, which allows exclusive access to a shared resource that is used by multiple devices.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextAnalyzer.AnalyzeBidi(SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextAnalysisSource,System.Int32,System.Int32,SlimDX.DirectWrite.TextAnalysisSink)
member.summary: Analyzes a text range for script directionality, reading attributes from the source and reporting levels to the sink callback SetBidiLevel.
member.param: Source object to analyze.
Starting position within the source object.
Length to analyze.
Callback object.
member.returns: 7 Standard Result error code.
member.remarks: While the function can handle multiple paragraphs, the text range should not arbitrarily split the middle of paragraphs. Otherwise the returned levels may be wrong, since the Bidi algorithm is meant to apply to the paragraph as a whole.
Embedded control codes (LRE/LRO/RLE/RLO/PDF) are taken into account.

member.param: Source object to analyze.
Starting position within the source object.
Length to analyze.
Callback object.
member.returns: Standard Result error code.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.OverhangMetrics.Bottom
member.summary: The distance from the bottom-most visible DIP to its lower alignment edge.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.OverhangMetrics.Right
member.summary: The distance from the right-most visible DIP to its right alignment edge.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.OverhangMetrics.Top
member.summary: The distance from the top-most visible DIP to its top alignment edge.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.OverhangMetrics.Left
member.summary: The distance from the left-most visible DIP to its left alignment edge.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectWrite.OverhangMetrics
member.summary:
Indicates how much any visible DIPs (device independent pixels) overshoot each side of the layout or inline objects.
Positive overhangs indicate that the visible area extends outside the layout box or inline object, while negative values mean there is whitespace inside. The returned values are unaffected by rendering transforms or pixel snapping. Additionally, they may not exactly match the final target's pixel bounds after applying grid fitting and hinting.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.InlineObjectMetrics.SupportsSideways
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the object is to be placed upright or alongside the text baseline for vertical text.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.InlineObjectMetrics.Baseline
member.summary: Distance from the top of the object to the baseline where it is lined up with the adjacent text. If the baseline is at the bottom, baseline simply equals height.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.InlineObjectMetrics.Height
member.summary: Height of the inline object as measured from top to bottom.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectWrite.InlineObjectMetrics.Width
member.summary: Width of the inline object.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectWrite.InlineObjectMetrics
member.summary: Properties describing the geometric measurement of an application-defined inline object.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DirectWrite.IFontFileLoader.CreateStreamFromKey(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a font file stream object that encapsulates an open file resource. The resource is closed when the last reference to fontFileStream is released.
member.param: Font file reference key that uniquely identifies the font file resource within the scope of the font loader being used.
Size of font file reference key in bytes.
member.returns: Reference to the newly created font file stream.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectWrite.IFontFileLoader
member.summary: Font file loader interface handles loading font file resources of a particular type from a key. The font file loader interface is recommended to be implemented by a singleton object. IMPORTANT: font file loader implementations must not register themselves with DirectWrite factory inside their constructors and must not unregister themselves in their destructors, because registration and underregistration operations increment and decrement the object reference count respectively. Instead, registration and underregistration of font file loaders with DirectWrite factory should be performed outside of the font file loader implementation as a separate step.

member.name: M:SlimDX.DirectWrite.IFontCollectionLoader.CreateEnumeratorFromKey(SlimDX.DirectWrite.Factory,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a font file enumerator object that encapsulates a collection of font files. The font system calls back to this interface to create a font collection.
member.param: Factory associated with the loader.
Font collection key that uniquely identifies the collection of font files within the scope of the font collection loader being used.
Size of the font collection key in bytes.
member.returns: Pointer to the newly created font file enumerator.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectWrite.IFontCollectionLoader
member.summary: The font collection loader interface is used to construct a collection of fonts given a particular type of key. The font collection loader interface is recommended to be implemented by a singleton object. IMPORTANT: font collection loader implementations must not register themselves with a DirectWrite factory inside their constructors and must not unregister themselves in their destructors, because registration and unregistraton operations increment and decrement the object reference count respectively. Instead, registration and unregistration of font file loaders with DirectWrite factory should be performed outside of the font file loader implementation as a separate step.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.RightMotorSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the right motor speed.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100% motor use.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.LeftMotorSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the left motor speed.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100% motor use.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration
member.summary: Specifies motor speed levels for the vibration function of a controller.
member.remarks: The left motor is the low-frequency rumble motor. The right motor is the high-frequency rumble motor. The two motors are not the same, and they create different vibration effects.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Zero-based stream index.

Type of output element; possible values include: "POSITION", "NORMAL", or "TEXCOORD0". Note that if SemanticName is null then ComponentCount can be greater than 4 and the described entry will be a gap in the stream out where no data will be written.
Output element's zero-based index. Should be used if, for example, you have more than one texture coordinate stored in each vertex.

Which component of the entry to begin writing out to. Valid values are 0 to 3. For example, if you only wish to output to the y and z components of a position, then StartComponent should be 1 and ComponentCount should be 2.

The number of components of the entry to write out to. Valid values are 1 to 4. For example, if you only wish to output to the y and z components of a position, then StartComponent should be 1 and ComponentCount should be 2. Note that if SemanticName is null then ComponentCount can be greater than 4 and the described entry will be a gap in the stream out where no data will be written.
The associated stream output buffer that is bound to the pipeline. Valid values range from 0 to 3.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.OutputSlot
member.summary: The associated stream output buffer that is bound to the pipeline. Valid values range from 0 to 3.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.ComponentCount
member.summary: The number of components of the entry to write out to. Valid values are 1 to 4. For example, if you only wish to output to the y and z components of a position, then StartComponent should be 1 and ComponentCount should be 2. Note that if SemanticName is null then ComponentCount can be greater than 4 and the described entry will be a gap in the stream out where no data will be written.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.StartComponent
member.summary: Which component of the entry to begin writing out to. Valid values are 0 to 3. For example, if you only wish to output to the y and z components of a position, then StartComponent should be 1 and ComponentCount should be 2.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.SemanticIndex
member.summary: Output element's zero-based index. Should be used if, for example, you have more than one texture coordinate stored in each vertex.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StreamOutputElement.SemanticName
member.summary: Type of output element; possible values include: "POSITION", "NORMAL", or "TEXCOORD0". Note that if SemanticName is null then ComponentCount can be greater than 4 and the described entry will be a gap in the stream out where no data will be written.

member.summary: Zero-based stream index.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad
member.summary: Describes the current state of the Xbox 360 Controller.
member.remarks: Each of the thumbstick axis members is a signed value between -32768 and 32767 describing the position of the thumbstick. A value of 0 is centered. Negative values signify down or to the left. Positive values signify up or to the right. The constants GamepadLeftThumbDeadZone or GamepadRightThumbDeadZone can be used as a positive and negative value to filter thumbstick input.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.MaximumLod
member.summary: Upper end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed. This value must be greater than or equal to MinimumLod. To have no upper limit on LOD set this to a large value such as float.MaxValue.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.MinimumLod
member.summary: Lower end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed.

member.summary: Border color to use if using border addressing mode.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.ComparisonFunction
member.summary: A function that compares sampled data against existing sampled data.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.MaximumAnisotropy
member.summary: Clamping value used if performing anisotropic filtering. Valid values are between 1 and 16.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.MipLodBias
member.summary: Offset from the calculated mipmap level. For example, if Direct3D calculates that a texture should be sampled at mipmap level 3 and MipLODBias is 2, then the texture will be sampled at mipmap level 5.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.AddressW
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a w texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.summary: Method to use for resolving a v texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.summary: Method to use for resolving a u texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Direct3D11.SamplerDescription.Filter
member.summary: Filtering method to use when sampling a texture.

member.summary: Equal to | .

member.summary: The operation completed successfully.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.SettingsNotSaved
member.summary: The settings have been successfully applied but could not be persisted.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.ReportFull
member.summary: failed because more information was requested to be sent than can be sent to the device. Some devices have restrictions on how much data can be sent to them. (For example, there might be a limit on the number of buttons that can be pressed at once.)

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.ReadOnly
member.summary: The specified property cannot be changed.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.PropertyHasNoEffect
member.summary: The change in device properties had no effect.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.PolledDevice
member.summary: The device is a polled device. As a result, device buffering will not collect any data and event notifications will not be signalled until GetCurrentState is called.

member.summary: The DInput subsystem couldn't allocate sufficient memory to complete the caller's request.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.OtherApplicationHasPriority
member.summary: Another app has a higher priority level, preventing this call from succeeding.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.OldDirectInputVersion
member.summary: The application requires a newer version of DirectInput.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.ObjectNotFound
member.summary: The requested object does not exist.

member.summary: This object has not been initialized.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.NotFound
member.summary: The requested object does not exist.

member.summary: The operation cannot be performed unless the device is acquired in exclusive mode.

member.summary: The effect is not downloaded.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.NotBuffered
member.summary: Attempted to read buffered device data from a device that is not buffered.

member.summary: The device exists but is not currently attached.

member.summary: The operation cannot be performed unless the device is acquired.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.NoInterface
member.summary: The specified interface is not supported by the object.

member.summary: The operation had no effect.

member.summary: This object does not support aggregation.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.MoreData
member.summary: Not all the requested information fit into the buffer.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.MapFileFail
member.summary: A mapper file function failed because reading or writing the user or IHV settings file failed.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.InvalidParameter
member.summary: An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function, or the object was not in a state that allowed the function to be called.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.InputLost
member.summary: Access to the device has been lost. It must be re-acquired.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.IncompleteEffect
member.summary: The effect could not be downloaded because essential information is missing. For example, no axes have been associated with the effect, or no type-specific information has been created.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.HasEffects
member.summary: The device cannot be reinitialized because there are still effects attached to it.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.HandleExists
member.summary: The device already has an event notification associated with it.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.Generic
member.summary: An undetermined error occured inside the DInput subsystem.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.Failure
member.summary: Represents a generic failure result.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.EffectRestarted
member.summary: The parameters of the effect were successfully updated by , but in order to change the parameters, the effect needed to be restarted.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.EffectPlaying
member.summary: An attempt was made to modify parameters of an effect while it is playing. Not all hardware devices support altering the parameters of an effect while it is playing.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.DownloadSkipped
member.summary: The parameters of the effect were successfully updated by , but the effect was not downloaded because the device is not exclusively acquired or because the NoDownload flag was passed.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.DeviceNotRegistered
member.summary: The device or device instance or effect is not registered with DirectInput.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.DeviceFull
member.summary: The device is full.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.BufferOverflow
member.summary: The device buffer overflowed. Some input was lost.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectInput.ResultCode.BetaDirectInputVersion

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.UnlockTransferRateHardwareBuffers
member.summary: The rate, in kilobytes per second, at which data can be transferred to hardware static sound buffers. This and the number of bytes transferred determines the duration of a call to the Buffer.Read or Buffer.Write method.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.TotalHardwareMemory
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the amount of memory on the sound card that stores static sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.SecondaryStereo
member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed stereo secondary buffers.

member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed monophonic secondary buffers.

member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed secondary sound buffers with 16-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryStereo
member.summary: The device supports stereo primary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryMono
member.summary: The device supports monophonic primary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryBuffers
member.summary: Number of primary buffers supported. This value will always be 1.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Primary8Bit
member.summary: The device supports primary buffers with 8-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Primary16Bit

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PlayCpuOverheadSoftwareBuffers
member.summary: The processing overhead, as a percentage of main processor cycles, needed to mix software buffers. This varies according to the bus type, the processor type, and the clock speed.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MinSecondarySampleRate
member.summary: Minimum sample rate specifications that are supported by this device's hardware secondary sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxSecondarySampleRate
member.summary: Maximum sample rate specifications that are supported by this device's hardware secondary sound buffers.

member.summary: Maximum number of streaming sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardwareMixingStaticBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of static buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardwareMixingAllBuffers
member.summary: Number of buffers that can be mixed in hardware. This member can be less than the sum of MaxHardwareMixingStaticBuffers and MaxHardwareMixingStreamingBuffers. Resource tradeoffs frequently occur.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardware3DStreamingBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of streaming 3-D buffers.

member.summary: Maximum number of static 3-D buffers.

member.summary: Maximum number of 3-D buffers.

member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the largest contiguous block of free memory on the sound card.

member.summary: Number of unallocated streaming buffers.

member.summary: Number of unallocated static buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardwareMixingAllBuffers

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.EmulatedDriver
member.summary: The device does not have a DirectSound driver installed, so it is being emulated through the waveform-audio functions. Performance degradation should be expected.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.ContinuousRate
member.summary: The device supports all sample rates between the MinSecondarySampleRate and MaxSecondarySampleRate member values. Typically, this means that the actual output rate will be within +/- 10 hertz (Hz) of the requested frequency.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Certified
member.summary: The driver has been tested and certified by Microsoft. This flag is always set for WDM drivers.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities
member.summary: Describes the capabilities of a DirectSound device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume
member.summary: Predefined audio volume attenuation values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume.Maximum
member.summary: Represents the original, unadjusted volume of the stream.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume.Minimum
member.summary: Indicates an audio volume attenuated by 100 dB, which, for all practical purposes, is silence.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying the play behavior of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByPriority
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be the one with the lowest priority as set by the priority parameter passed to SecondarySoundBuffer::Play for the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByDistance
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be selected from buffers that have the buffer's BufferFlags::Mute3DAtMaxDistance flag set and are beyond their maximum distance. If there are no such buffers, the method fails.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByTime
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing nonlooping buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated is the one with the least time left to play.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Software
member.summary: Play this voice in a software buffer only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Hardware
member.summary: Play this voice in a hardware buffer only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Looping
member.summary: Play continues until explicitly stopped. This flag must be set when playing a primary buffer.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.I3DL2ReverbPreset
member.summary: Values that specify a standard reverberation preset.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry
member.summary: Various speaker configurations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Maximum
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 180 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Wide
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 20 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Narrow
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 10 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Minimum
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 5 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.SevenPointOneWide
member.summary: same as SevenPointOne

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.SevenPointOneSurround
member.summary: correct 7.1 Home Theater setting

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.SevenPointOne
member.summary: obsolete 7.1 setting

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.FivePointOne
member.summary: obsolete 5.1 setting

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.Surround
member.summary: The audio is played through surround speakers. This specifies a four-channel PCM format in which the channels are mapped to left, right, center, and back speakers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.Stereo
member.summary: The audio is played through stereo speakers (default value).

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.Quadrophonic
member.summary: The audio is played through quadraphonic speakers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.Mono
member.summary: The audio is played through a single speaker.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.Headphone
member.summary: The audio is played through (stereo) headphones.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerConfiguration.DirectOut
member.summary: The audio is passed through directly, without being configured for speakers. This specifies a speakerless configuration in which the channels in the playback stream from the application are output directly to the audio adapter without being interpreted as speaker positions. However, the input stream can still be modified by sample-rate conversion, attenuation, filtering, and other types of processing that require no assumptions about the assignment of speakers to channels.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult
member.summary: Indicates the result of the attempt to set an effect in the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Unknown
member.summary: Effect is not registered on the system, and the method failed as a result.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Failed
member.summary: No effect was created because resources weren't available.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Unallocated
member.summary: Effect has not yet been assigned to hardware or software. This value is returned if the buffer was created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag in Flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.LocatedInSoftware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in software.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.LocatedInHardware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Present
member.summary: Effect is available but was not created because one of the other effects requested could not be created. If any of the effects requested cannot be created, none of them are, and the call fails.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D
member.summary: The 3-D sound processing mode to be set.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.Disable
member.summary: Processing of 3D sound is disabled. The sound seems to originate from the center of the listener's head.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.HeadRelative
member.summary: Sound parameters (position, velocity, and orientation) are relative to the listener's parameters. In this mode, the absolute parameters of the sound are updated automatically as the listener's parameters change, so that the relative parameters remain constant.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.Normal
member.summary: Normal processing. This is the default mode.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags
member.summary: Various sound buffer locking flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags.EntireBuffer
member.summary: Lock the entire buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags.FromWriteCursor
member.summary: Start the lock at the write cursor.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel
member.summary: Values specifying the cooperative level of the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.WritePrimary
member.summary: Sets the write-primary level. The application has write access to the primary buffer. No secondary buffers can be played.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.Priority
member.summary: Sets the priority level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.Normal
member.summary: Sets the normal level. This level has the smoothest multitasking and resource-sharing behavior, but because it does not allow the primary buffer format to change, output is restricted to the default 8-bit format.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult
member.summary: Return values for Capture effects.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult.LocatedInSoftware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in software.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult.LocatedInHardware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in hardware.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus
member.summary: Flags specifying the status of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Terminated
member.summary: The buffer was prematurely terminated by the voice manager and is not playing. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Software
member.summary: The buffer is playing in software. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Hardware
member.summary: The buffer is playing in hardware. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Looping
member.summary: The buffer is being looped. If this value is not set, the buffer will stop when it reaches the end of the sound data. This value is returned only in combination with BufferStatus::Playing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.BufferLost
member.summary: The buffer is lost and must be restored before it can be played or locked.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Playing
member.summary: The buffer is playing. If this value is not set, the buffer is stopped.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying the capabilities of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Defer
member.summary: The buffer can be assigned to a hardware or software resource at play time.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Mute3DAtMaxDistance
member.summary: The sound is reduced to silence at the maximum distance. The buffer will stop playing when the maximum distance is exceeded, so that processor time is not wasted. Applies only to software buffers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.GetCurrentPosition2
member.summary: The buffer uses the new behavior of the play cursor when retrieving the current position.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.GlobalFocus
member.summary: The buffer is a global sound buffer. With this flag set, an application using DirectSound can continue to play its buffers if the user switches focus to another application, even if the new application uses DirectSound.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.StickyFocus
member.summary: The buffer has sticky focus. If the user switches to another application not using DirectSound, the buffer is still audible. However, if the user switches to another DirectSound application, the buffer is muted.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlEffects
member.summary: The buffer supports effects processing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlPositionNotify
member.summary: The buffer has position notification capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlVolume
member.summary: The buffer has volume control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlPan
member.summary: The buffer has pan control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlFrequency
member.summary: The buffer has frequency control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Control3D
member.summary: The buffer has 3D control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Software
member.summary: The buffer is in software memory and uses software mixing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Hardware
member.summary: The buffer uses hardware mixing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Static
member.summary: The buffer is in on-board hardware memory.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.PrimaryBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is a primary buffer.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.AcousticEchoCancelMode
member.summary: Values indicating the acoustic echo cancellation operation mode.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.AcousticEchoCancelMode.FullDuplex
member.summary: The effect is running in full duplex mode.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.AcousticEchoCancelMode.HalfDuplex
member.summary: The effect is running in half duplex mode. Not presently supported.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.AcousticEchoCancelMode.PassThrough
member.summary: The effect is passing capture and render data through without modifying it.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.NoVirtualization3DAlgorithm
member.summary: 3-D output is mapped into normal left and right stereo panning. At 90 degrees to the left, the sound is coming out of only the left speaker; at 90 degrees to the right, sound is coming out of only the right speaker. The vertical axis is ignored except for scaling of volume due to distance. Doppler shift and volume scaling are still applied, but the 3-D filtering is not performed on this buffer. This is the most efficient software implementation, but provides no virtual 3-D audio effect.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.LightHrt3DAlgorithm
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the efficient 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives a good 3-D audio effect, but uses fewer CPU cycles than Guid3DAlgorithmHrtfFull

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.FullHrt3DAlgorithm
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the high quality 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives the highest quality 3-D audio effect, but uses more CPU cycles.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.Default3DAlgorithm
member.summary: Default 3-D algorithm

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid
member.summary: Contains system-defined identifiers for DirectSound 3-D Algorithms.

End matrix.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector3.DistanceSquared(SlimDX.Vector3,SlimDX.Vector3)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector2.DistanceSquared(SlimDX.Vector2,SlimDX.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector4.DistanceSquared(SlimDX.Vector4,SlimDX.Vector4)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors.

member.returns: The distance between the two vectors.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Direct3D11.InputElement.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,SlimDX.DXGI.Format,System.Int32,System.Int32,SlimDX.Direct3D11.InputClassification,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The HLSL semantic associated with this element in a shader input-signature.

The semantic index for the element. A semantic index modifies a semantic, with an integer index number. A semantic index is only needed in a case where there is more than one element with the same semantic. For example, a 4x4 matrix would have four components each with the semantic name matrix, however each of the four component would have different semantic indices (0, 1, 2, and 3).
The data type of the element data.
Offset (in bytes) between each element. Use AppendAligned for convenience to define the current element directly after the previous one, including any packing if necessary.
An integer value that identifies the input-assembler. Valid values are between 0 and 15.
Identifies the input data class for a single input slot.
The number of instances to draw using the same per-instance data before advancing in the buffer by one element. This value must be 0 for an element that contains per-vertex data.

member.name: T:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType
member.summary: Identifies shader parameters that use system-value semantics.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalLineDensityTessellationFactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the amount of lines that are created within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate an isolines patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalLineDetailTessellationFactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the amount of lines broken into within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate an isolines patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalTriangleInsideTessellationFactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the amount of parts that a tri patch is broken into within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate a tri patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalTriangleEdgeTessellationFactor
member.summary: This parameter contains one of three tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a tri patch is broken into along the given edge. This flag is used to tessellate a tri patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalQuadInsideTessellationFactor
member.summary: This parameter contains one of two tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a quad patch is broken into vertically and horizontally within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate a quad patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalQuadEdgeTessellationFactor
member.summary: his parameter contains one of four tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a quad patch is broken into along the given edge. This flag is used to tessellate a quad patch.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.DepthLessEqual
member.summary: This parameter signifies that the value is less than or equal to a reference value. This flag is used to specify conservative depth for a pixel shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.DepthGreaterEqual
member.summary: This parameter signifies that the value is greater than or equal to a reference value. This flag is used to specify conservative depth for a pixel shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Coverage
member.summary: This parameter contains alpha-coverage data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Depth
member.summary: This parameter contains depth data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Target
member.summary: This parameter contains render-target data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.SampleIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a sampler-array index.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FrontFaceFlag
member.summary: This parameter contains data that identifies whether or not the primitive faces the camera.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.InstanceId
member.summary: This parameter contains a instance ID.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.PrimitiveId
member.summary: This parameter contains a primitive ID.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.VertexId
member.summary: This parameter contains a vertex ID.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.ViewportArrayIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a viewport-array index.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.RenderTargetArrayIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a render-target-array index.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.CullDistance
member.summary: This parameter contains cull distance data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.ClipDistance
member.summary: This parameter contains clip-distance data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Position
member.summary: This parameter contains position data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Undefined
member.summary: This parameter does not use a predefined system-value semantic.

member.summary: Identifies shader input options.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderInputFlags.TextureComponents
member.summary: A 2-bit value for encoding texture components.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderInputFlags.TextureComponent1
member.summary: A 2-bit value for encoding texture components.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderInputFlags.TextureComponent0
member.summary: A 2-bit value for encoding texture components.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderInputFlags.ComparisonSampler
member.summary: Use a comparison sampler, which uses the SampleCmp and SampleCmpLevelZero sampling functions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderInputFlags.UserPacked
member.summary: Assign a shader input to a register based on the register assignment in the HLSL code (instead of letting the compiler choose the register).

member.name: T:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags
member.summary: Provides various shader compilation flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.WarningsAreErrors
member.summary: Inform the HLSL compiler to treat all warnings as errors when compiling the shader code. For new shader code, you should use this option so you can resolve all warnings and ensure the fewest possible hard-to-find code defects.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel3
member.summary: Highest optimization level. Will produce best possible code but may take significantly longer to do so. This will be useful for final builds of an application where performance is the most important factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel2
member.summary: Second highest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel1
member.summary: Second lowest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel0
member.summary: Lowest optimization level. May produce slower code but will do so more quickly. This may be useful in a highly iterative shader development cycle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.EnableIEEEStrictness
member.summary: Enables IEEE floating point strictness.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.EnableBackwardsCompatibility
member.summary: This enables older shaders to compile to 4_0 targets.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.EnableStrictness
member.summary: By default, the HLSL compiler disables strictness on deprecated syntax. Specifying this flag enables strictness which may not allow for legacy syntax.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.PreferFlowControl
member.summary: Tells the compiler to use flow-control (when possible).

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.AvoidFlowControl
member.summary: Tells the compiler to not allow flow-control (when possible).

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.NoPreshader
member.summary: Disables Preshaders. Using this flag will cause the compiler to not pull out static expression for evaluation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.ForceSoftwarePixelShader
member.summary: Compile a pixel shader for the next highest shader profile. This option turns debugging on (and optimizations off).

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.ForceSoftwareVertexShader
member.summary: Compile a vertex shader for the next highest shader profile. This option turns debugging on (and optimizations off).

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.PartialPrecision
member.summary: Force all computations to be done with partial precision; this may run faster on some hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixColumnMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in column-major order on input and output from the shader. This is generally more efficient, since it allows vector-matrix multiplication to be performed using a series of dot-products.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixRowMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in row-major order on input and output from the shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.SkipOptimization
member.summary: Skip optimization during code generation; generally recommended for debug only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Do not validate the generated code against known capabilities and constraints. Only use this with shaders that have been successfully compiled in the past. Shaders are always validated by DirectX before they are set to the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.Debug
member.summary: Insert debug file/line/type/symbol information into the resulting shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags.None
member.summary: No specific compilation options.

member.summary: Do not attempt to synchronize with other threads loading effects into the same pool.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.EffectFlags.AllowSlowOperations
member.summary: Allow mutable state objects (non-literal expressions may appear in state object definitions). This has a negative impact on run-time performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.D3DCompiler.EffectFlags.ChildEffect
member.summary: Compile the .fx file to a child effect. Child effects do not initialize shared values (as those values are instead initialized by the effect pool).

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode
member.summary: Identifies techniques for resolving texture coordinates that are outside of the boundaries of a texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode.MirrorOnce
member.summary: Similar to Mirror and Clamp. Takes the absolute value of the texture coordinate (thus, mirroring around 0), and then clamps to the maximum value.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode.Border
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the border color.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode.Clamp
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the texture color at 0.0 or 1.0, respectively.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode.Mirror
member.summary: Flip the texture at every (u,v) integer junction. For u values between 0 and 1, for example, the texture is addressed normally; between 1 and 2, the texture is flipped (mirrored); between 2 and 3, the texture is normal again; and so on.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.TextureAddressMode.Wrap
member.summary: Tile the texture at every (u,v) integer junction. For example, for u values between 0 and 3, the texture is repeated three times.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.StencilOperation.Keep

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceUsage
member.summary: Identifies expected resource use during rendering. The usage directly reflects whether a resource is accessible by the CPU and/or the GPU.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceUsage.Staging
member.summary: A resource that supports data transfer (copy) from the GPU to the CPU.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceUsage.Dynamic
F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceUsage.Immutable
member.summary: A resource that can only be read by the GPU. It cannot be written by the GPU, and cannot be accessed at all by the CPU. This type of resource must be initialized when it is created, since it cannot be changed after creation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceUsage.Default
member.summary: A resource that requires read and write access by the GPU. This is likely to be the most common usage choice.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags
member.summary: Identifies other, less common options for resources.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.GdiCompatible
member.summary: Renders a resource compatible with GDI.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.KeyedMutex
member.summary: Enables a resource as a keyed mutex.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.ClampedResource
member.summary: Enables a resource with a clamped depth bias.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.StructuredBuffer
member.summary: Enables a resource as a structured buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.RawBuffer
member.summary: Enables a resource as a byte address buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.DrawIndirect
member.summary: Enables instancing of GPU-generated content.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.TextureCube
member.summary: Enables a resource to be a cube texture created from a Texture2DArray that contains 6 textures.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.Shared
member.summary: Enables resource data sharing between two or more Direct3D devices. The only resources that can be shared are 2D non-mipmapped textures.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.GenerateMipMaps
member.summary: Enables mipmap generation on a texture resource. The resource must be created with the bind flags that specify that the resource is a render target and a shader resource.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ResourceOptionFlags.None
member.summary: No additional options specified.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType
member.summary: Defines possible query types.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.StreamOutputOverflowPredicate
member.summary: Determines whether or not any of the streaming output buffers overflowed in between DeviceContext.Begin and DeviceContext.End. DeviceContext.GetData returns a boolean; true meaning there was an overflow, and false meaning there was not an overflow. If streaming output writes to multiple buffers, and one of the buffers overflows, then it will stop writing to all the output buffers. When an overflow is detected by Direct3D it is prevented from happening - no memory is corrupted. This predication may be used in conjunction with a StreamOutputStatistics query so that when an overflow occurs the query will let the application know how much memory was needed to prevent an overflow.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.StreamOutputStatistics
member.summary: Get streaming output statistics, such as the number of primitives streamed out in between DeviceContext.Begin and DeviceContext.End. DeviceContext.GetData will return a structure.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.Predicate
member.summary: Similar to an occlusion query, except DeviceContext.GetData returns a boolean indicating whether or not any samples passed

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.PipelineStatistics
member.summary: Get pipeline statistics, such as the number of pixel shader invocations in between DeviceContext.Begin and DeviceContext.End. DeviceContext.GetData will return a instance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.TimestampDisjoint
member.summary: Determines whether or not a Timestamp query is returning reliable values, and also gives the frequency of the processor enabling you to convert the number of elapsed ticks into seconds. DeviceContext.GetData will return a instance. This type of query should only be invoked once per frame or less.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.Timestamp
member.summary: Get a timestamp value where DeviceContext.GetData returns a long. This kind of query is only useful if two timestamp queries are done in the middle of a TimestampDisjoint query. The difference of two timestamps can be used to determine how many ticks have elapsed, and the TimestampDisjoint query will determine if that difference is a reliable value and also has a value that shows how to convert the number of ticks into seconds. When using this type of query, DeviceContext.Begin is disabled.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.Occlusion
member.summary: Get the number of samples that passed the depth and stencil tests in between DeviceContext.Begin and DeviceContext.End. DeviceContext.GetData returns a long. If a depth or stencil test is disabled, then each of those tests will be counted as a pass.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryType.Event
member.summary: Determines whether or not the GPU is finished processing commands. When the GPU is finished processing commands DeviceContext.GetData will return success, and the result will be a boolean with a value of true. When using this type of query, DeviceContext.Begin is disabled.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags for describing query options and behavior.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryFlags.PredicateHint
member.summary: Tell the hardware that if it is not yet sure if something is hidden or not to draw it anyway. This is only used with an occlusion predicate. Predication data cannot be returned to your application via DeviceContext.GetData when using this flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.QueryFlags.None
member.summary: No particular flags specified.

member.summary: Windows Media Player format (WMP).

member.summary: Graphics Interchange Format (GIF).

member.summary: Tagged Image File Format (TIFF).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ImageFileFormat.Dds
member.summary: DirectDraw surface (DDS) file format. Stores textures, volume textures, and cubic environment maps, with or without mipmap levels, and with or without pixel compression.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ImageFileFormat.Png
member.summary: Portable Network Graphics (PNG) file format. A non-proprietary bitmap format using lossless compression.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ImageFileFormat.Jpg
member.summary: Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) compressed file format. Specifies variable compression of 24-bit RGB color and 8-bit gray-scale Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) image document files.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.ImageFileFormat.Bmp
member.summary: Windows bitmap (BMP) file format. Contains a header that describes the resolution of the device on which the rectangle of pixels was created, the dimensions of the rectangle, the size of the array of bits, a logical palette, and an array of bits that defines the relationship between pixels in the bitmapped image and entries in the logical palette.

member.summary: Combines the StandardRgbIn and StandardRgbOut flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.StandardRgbOut
member.summary: Output data is in standard RGB (sRGB) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.StandardRgbIn
member.summary: Input data is in standard RGB (sRGB) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.DitherDiffusion
member.summary: Do diffuse dithering on the image when changing from one format to another.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Dither
member.summary: The resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered dither algorithm. This happens when converting from one format to another.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Mirror
member.summary: Combines the MirrorU, MirrorV, and MirrorW flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.MirrowW
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the w-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with mipmaps.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Triangle
member.summary: Every pixel in the source image contributes equally to the destination image. This is the slowest of the filters.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Linear
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the four nearest pixels from the source image. This filter works best when the scale on both axes is less than two.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.FilterFlags.None
member.summary: No scaling or filtering will take place. Pixels outside the bounds of the source image are assumed to be transparent black.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType
member.summary: Specifies possible driver types.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Warp
member.summary: A WARP driver, which is a high-performance software rasterizer. The rasterizer supports all current feature levels (level 9.1 through level 10.1) with a high performance software implementation when hardware is not available.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Software
member.summary: A software driver, which is a driver implemented completely in software. The software implementation is not intended for a high-performance application due to its very slow performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Null
member.summary: A NULL driver, which is a reference driver without render capability. This driver is commonly used for debugging non-rendering API calls, it is not appropriate for retail applications. This driver is installed by the DirectX SDK.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Reference
member.summary: A reference driver, which is a software implementation that supports every Direct3D feature. A reference driver is designed for accuracy rather than speed and as a result is slow but accurate. The rasterizer portion of the driver does make use of special CPU instructions whenever it can, but it is not intended for retail applications; use it only for feature testing, demonstration of functionality, debugging, or verifying bugs in other drivers. This driver is installed by the DirectX SDK. This driver may be referred to as a REF driver, a reference driver or a reference rasterizer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Hardware
member.summary: A hardware driver, which implements Direct3D features in hardware. This is the primary driver that you should use in your Direct3D applications because it provides the best performance. A hardware driver uses hardware acceleration (on supported hardware) but can also use software for parts of the pipeline that are not supported in hardware. This driver type is often referred to as a hardware abstraction layer or HAL.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DriverType.Unknown
member.summary: The driver type is unknown.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DeviceCreationFlags
member.summary: Describes parameters that are used to create a device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DeviceCreationFlags.PreventThreadingOptimizations
member.summary: Prevents multiple threads from being created. This flag is not recommended for general use.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DeviceCreationFlags.Debug
member.summary: Creates a device that supports the debug layer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DeviceCreationFlags.SingleThreaded
member.summary: Use this flag if an application will only be calling D3D11 from a single thread. If this flag is not specified, the default behavior of D3D11 is to enter a lock during each API call to prevent multiple threads altering internal state. By using this flag no locks will be taken which can slightly increase performance, but could result in undefine behavior if D3D11 is called from multiple threads.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.DeviceCreationFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates no specific behavior.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.CpuAccessFlags.Read
member.summary: The resource is to be mappable so that the CPU can read its contents. Resources created with this flag cannot be set as either inputs or outputs to the pipeline and must be created with staging usage.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.CpuAccessFlags.Write
member.summary: The resource is to be mappable so that the CPU can change its contents. Resources created with this flag cannot be set as outputs of the pipeline and must be created with either dynamic or staging usage.

member.summary: Specifies possible comparison functions.

member.summary: Always pass the comparison.

member.summary: Pass the comparison if the source data is greater than or equal to the destination data.

member.summary: Pass the comparison if the source data is less than the destination data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.Comparison.Never
member.summary: Never pass the comparison.

member.summary: Indicates the luminances of the red, green, and blue channels should be used.

member.summary: Indicates the alpha channel should be used.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption
member.summary: Blend options. A blend option identifies the data source and an optional pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseSecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are both alpha data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A. This option supports dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.SecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are both alpha data from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation. This option supports dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseSecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB. This option supports dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.SecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation. This option supports dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseBlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set in the output-merger blend state. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - blend_factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.BlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set in the output-merger blend state. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.SourceAlphaSaturate
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation clamps the data to 1 or less.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseDestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a render target. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.DestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a render target. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseDestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a render target. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.DestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a render target. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseSourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.SourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.InverseSourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.SourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.One
member.summary: The data source is the color white (1, 1, 1, 1). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOption.Zero
member.summary: The data source is the color black (0, 0, 0, 0). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation
member.summary: RGB or alpha blending operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation.Maximum
member.summary: Find the maximum of source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation.Minimum
member.summary: Find the minimum of source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation.ReverseSubtract
member.summary: Subtract source 2 from source 1.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation.Subtract
member.summary: Subtract source 1 from source 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BlendOperation.Add
member.summary: Add source 1 and source 2.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags
member.summary: Identifies how to bind a resource to the pipeline.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.UnorderedAccess
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound as an unordered access resource.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.DepthStencil
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the output-merger stage as a depth-stencil target.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.RenderTarget
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the output-merger stage as a render target.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.StreamOutput
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the stream-output stage as an output buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.ShaderResource
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the shader stage as a buffer or texture. Note that it is invalid to specify this flag and subsequently map the resource using MapMode.WriteNoOverwrite.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.ConstantBuffer
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the shader stage as a constant buffer

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.IndexBuffer
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the input-assembler stage as an index buffer

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.VertexBuffer
member.summary: Indicates the resource can be bound to the input-assembler stage as a vertex buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.BindFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates no specific behavior.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D11.AsynchronousFlags
member.summary: Optional flags that control the behavior of Asynchronous.GetData.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.AsynchronousFlags.DoNotFlush
member.summary: Indicates the command buffer should not be flushed. Note that this can cause an infinite loop if GetData() is called repeatedly until returning successfully: there may still be commands in the buffer than need to be processed in order for GetData() to return successfully. Since the buffer will not be flushed, those commands will not be processed and GetData() will never return successfully.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D11.AsynchronousFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates no specific behavior.

member.summary: Describes an animation track and specifies blending weight, speed, and position for the track at a given time.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.VertexTextureSampler
member.summary: Identifies texture samplers used by vertex shaders.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage
member.summary: Texture stage states define multi-blender texture operations. Some sampler states set up vertex processing, and some set up pixel processing. Texture stage states can be saved and restored using stateblocks.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.Constant
member.summary: Per-stage constant color. Use packed integer colors to set this state.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.ResultArg
member.summary: Setting to select the destination register for the result of this stage. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Current.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.AlphaArg0
member.summary: Settings for the third alpha operand for triadic operations. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Current.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.ColorArg0
member.summary: Settings for the third color operand for triadic operations. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Current.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.TextureTransformFlags
member.summary: Specifies transformation options for texture coordinates. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Disable.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentLOffset
member.summary: Floating-point offset value for bump-map luminance. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentLScale
member.summary: Floating-point scale value for bump-map luminance. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.TexCoordIndex
member.summary: Index of the texture coordinate set to use with this texture stage. You can specify up to eight sets of texture coordinates per vertex. If a vertex does not include a set of texture coordinates at the specified index, the system defaults to the u and v coordinates (0,0).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentMat11
member.summary: Texture-stage state is a floating-point value for the [1][1] coefficient in a bump-mapping matrix. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentMat10
member.summary: Texture-stage state is a floating-point value for the [1][0] coefficient in a bump-mapping matrix. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentMat01
member.summary: Texture-stage state is a floating-point value for the [0][1] coefficient in a bump-mapping matrix. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.BumpEnvironmentMat00
member.summary: Texture-stage state is a floating-point value for the [0][0] coefficient in a bump-mapping matrix. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.AlphaArg2
member.summary: Texture-stage state is the second alpha argument for the stage. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Current.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.AlphaArg1
member.summary: Texture-stage state is the first alpha argument for the stage. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.AlphaOperation
F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.ColorArg2
member.summary: Texture-stage state is the second color argument for the stage. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Current.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureStage.ColorArg1
member.summary: Texture-stage state is the first color argument for the stage. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Texture.
