member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation
member.summary: Defines per-stage texture blending operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Lerp
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between the second and third source arguments by a proportion specified in the first source argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.MultiplyAdd
member.summary: Performs a multiply-accumulate operation. It takes the last two arguments, multiplies them together, and adds them to the remaining input/source argument, and places that into the result.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.DotProduct3
member.summary: Modulate the components of each argument as signed components, add their products; then replicate the sum to all color channels, including alpha.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BumpEnvironmentMapLuminance
member.summary: Perform per-pixel bump mapping, using the environment map in the next stage, with luminance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BumpEnvironmentMap
member.summary: Perform per-pixel bump mapping, using the environment map in the next stage.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateInvColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Modulate the arguments, inverting the first argument, then add the alpha of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateInvAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Modulate the color of the second argument, using the inverted alpha from the first argument, and then add the result to argument one.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Modulate the arguments, then add the alpha of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Modulate the color of the second argument, using the alpha from the first argument, and then add the result to argument one.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Premodulate
member.summary: Premodulate the arguments with the next stage's values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendCurrentAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the alpha from the previous stage.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlphaPM
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using a premultiplied alpha.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendFactorAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the current texture factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the alpha from the stage's texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendDiffuseAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the interpolated alpha from each vertex.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSmooth
member.summary: Add the first and second arguments, and then subtract their product from the sum.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Subtract
member.summary: Subtract the components of the second argument from the components of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSigned2X
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSigned
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Add
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate4X
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate2X
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.SelectArg2
member.summary: Use the current stage's second color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.SelectArg1
member.summary: Use the current stage's first color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Disable
member.summary: Disabled output from the current stage and all higher stages.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex
member.summary: Driver texture coordinate capability flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex.SphereMap
member.summary: Use the specified coordinates for sphere mapping.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex.CameraSpaceReflectionVector
member.summary: Use the reflection vector, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinates.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex.CameraSpacePosition
member.summary: Use the vertex position, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinates.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex.CameraSpaceNormal
member.summary: Use the vertex normal, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinates.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureCoordIndex.PassThru
member.summary: Use the specified texture coordinates contained in the vertex format.

member.summary: A floating point value that is used for comparison of depth values.

member.summary: Present operations will not be affected more than four times every screen refresh.

member.summary: Present operations will not be affected more than three times every screen refresh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentInterval.Two
member.summary: Present operations will not be affected more than twice every screen refresh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentInterval.One
member.summary: The device will wait for the vertical retrace period.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentInterval.Immediate
member.summary: The device will present immediately without waiting for the refresh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentInterval.Default

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags
member.summary: Specifies possible presentation flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.RestrictSharedResourceDriver
member.summary: Indicates that the driver should restrict access to any shared resources that are created for DWM interaction. The caller must create an authenticated channel with the driver. The driver should then allow access to processes that attempt to open those shared resources. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.RestrictedContent
member.summary: Indicates that the swapchain contains protected content and automatically causes the runtime to restrict access to the swapchain so that only the Desktop Windows Manager (DWM) can use the swapchain. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.OverlayYCbCr_xvYCC
member.summary: Indicates that the overlay is extended YCbCr (xvYCC). Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.OverlayYCbCr_BT709
member.summary: Indicates that the overlay is BT.709, for high-definition TV (HDTV). Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.OverlayLimitedRgb
member.summary: Indicates limited range RGB. In limited range RGB, the RGB range is compressed such that 16:16:16 is black and 235:235:235 is white. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.Video
member.summary: This is a hint to the driver that the back buffers will contain video data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.UnprunedMode
member.summary: Allows the device to use invalid display modes as if they were valid. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.NoAutoRotate
member.summary: Specifies that the application will perform its own display rotation. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.None
member.summary: No extra presentation flags specified.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.LockableBackBuffer
member.summary: Set when the application requires the ability to lock the back buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.DiscardDepthStencil
member.summary: Discards the contents of the depth/stencil surface after each presentation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.PresentFlags.DeviceClip
member.summary: Clips the presentation to the device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present
member.summary: Defines flags for presentation calls.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.UpdateColorKey
member.summary: Redraws the colorkey data. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.HideOverlay
member.summary: Turns off the overlay hardware. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.UpdateOverlayOnly
member.summary: Updates the overlay position or the colorkey data without causing an actual flip and without changing the duration with which the image is displayed. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.ForceImmediate
member.summary: PresentInterval.Immediate is enforced on this Present call. This flag can only be specified when using SwapEffect.FlipEx. Windowed and fullscreen presentation behaviors are the same. This is especially useful for media apps that want to discard frames that have been detected as late and present subsequent frames at composition time. An invalid parameter error will be returned if this flag is improperly specified. When multiple consecutive frames with Present.ForceImmediate are queued, only the last frame is displayed, for both windowed and fullscreen presentation. Available in Direct3D9Ex on Windows 7 only

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.LinearContent
member.summary: The content of the backbuffer to be presented is in linear color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.VideoRestrictToMonitor
member.summary: Clips the rendered content to the monitor/device that the adapter is targetting. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.FlipRestart
member.summary: The application will discard all previously queued frames and present the current frame next. Available in Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.DoNotWait
member.summary: Specifies that the application should not wait for rendering to finish.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.DoNotFlip
member.summary: Use the front buffer as both the source and the target surface during rendering. Available for Direct3D9Ex only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Present.None
member.summary: No extra presentation flags.

member.summary: Defines the memory class that holds the buffers for a resource.

member.summary: Resources are placed in scratch memory. These resources cannot be used as textures or render targets.

member.summary: Resources are placed in system memory that is not accessable by the device. These resources do not need to be recreated when the device is lost.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Pool.Managed
member.summary: Resources are copied automatically to device-accessable memory as needed. Managed resources are backed by system memory and do not need to be recreated when the device is lost.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Pool.Default
member.summary: Resources are placed in the memory pool most appropriate for the set of usages requested for the resource.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.VertexFormatCaps.DoNotStripElements
member.summary: It is preferable that vertex elements not be stripped. That is, if the vertex format contains elements that are not used with the current render states, there is no need to regenerate the vertices. If this capability flag is not present, stripping extraneous elements from the vertex format provides better performance.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect
member.summary: Defines swap effects.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect.FlipEx
member.summary: Designates when an application is adopting flip mode, during which time an application's frame is passed instead of copied to the Desktop Window Manager(DWM) for composition when the application is presenting in windowed mode. Flip mode allows an application to more efficiently use memory bandwidth as well as enabling an application to take advantage of full-screen-present statistics. Flip mode does not affect full-screen behavior. Available in Direct3D 9Ex on Windows 7 only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect.Overlay
member.summary: Use a dedicated area of video memory that can be overlayed on the primary surface. No copy is performed when the overlay is displayed. The overlay operation is performed in hardware, without modifying the data in the primary surface. Available in Direct3D 9Ex on Windows 7 only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect.Copy
member.summary: Copies the data between back buffers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect.Flip
member.summary: Flips between multiple back buffers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SwapEffect.Discard
member.summary: Discards the data in the back buffers and render targets after a presentation.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags
member.summary: Specifies options for welding together vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: Instructs the weld not to split vertices that are in separate attribute groups.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.DoNotRemoveVertices
member.summary: Instructs the weld to allow only modifications to vertices and not removal. This flag is valid only if WeldPartialMatches is set. It is useful to modify vertices to be equal, but not to allow vertices to be removed.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.WeldPartialMatches
member.summary: If a given vertex component is within epsilon, modify partially matched vertices so that both components are identical. If all components are equal, remove one of the vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.WeldAll
member.summary: Weld together all vertices that are at the same location.

member.summary: Defines the transition style between values of a mesh animation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TransitionType.EaseInEaseOut
member.summary: Ease-in, ease-out spline transition between values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TransitionType.Linear
member.summary: Linear transition between values.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority
member.summary: Defines the priority type to which an animation track is assigned.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority.High
member.summary: Track should be blended with all the high-priority tracks before the high-priority blend is mixed with the low-priority blend.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority.Low
member.summary: Track should be blended with all the low-priority tracks before the low-priority blend is mixed with the high-priority blend.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions
member.summary: Defines settings used for mesh tangent frame computations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.GenerateInPlace
member.summary: The results are stored in the original input mesh, and the output mesh is not used.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.CalculateNormals
member.summary: Compute the per-vertex normal vector for each triangle of the input mesh, and ignore any normal vectors already in the input mesh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WindCW
member.summary: Vertices are ordered in a clockwise direction around each triangle. The computed normal vector direction is therefore inverted 180 degrees from the direction computed using counterclockwise vertex ordering.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WeightEqual
member.summary: Compute a unit-length normal vector for each triangle of the input mesh. Mutually exclusive with WeightByArea.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WeightByArea
member.summary: Weight the direction of the computed per-vertex normal or partial derivative vector according to the areas of triangles attached to that vertex. Mutually exclusive with WeightEqual.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.OrthogonalizeFromU
member.summary: Compute the partial derivative with respect to texture coordinate u independently for each vertex, and then compute the partial derivative with respect to V as the cross product of the normal vector and the partial derivative with respect to U. Mutually exclusive with DontOrthogonalize and OrthogonalizeFromV.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.OrthogonalizeFromV
member.summary: Compute the partial derivative with respect to texture coordinate V independently for each vertex, and then compute the partial derivative with respect to U as the cross product of the partial derivative with respect to V and the normal vector. Mutually exclusive with DontOrthogonalize and OrthogonalizeFromU.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.DontOrthogonalize
member.summary: Do not transform texture coordinates to orthogonal Cartesian coordinates. Mutually exclusive with OrthogonalizeFromU and OrthogonalizeFromV.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.DontNormalizePartials
member.summary: Do not normalize partial derivatives with respect to texture coordinates. If not normalized, the scale of the partial derivatives is proportional to the scale of the 3D model divided by the scale of the triangle in (U, V) space. This scale value provides a measure of how much the texture is stretched in a given direction. The resulting vector length is a weighted sum of the lengths of the partial derivatives.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapUV
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in both U and V directions are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapV
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in the V direction are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapU
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in the U direction are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags
member.summary: Flags used to specify sprite rendering options to the flags parameter in the Sprite.Begin method.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotAddRefTexture
member.summary: Disables calling AddRef() on every draw, and Release() on Flush() for better performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortDepthBackToFront
member.summary: Sprites are sorted by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths. You may combine SortDepthBackToFront with SortTexture to sort first by depth, and second by texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortDepthFrontToBack
member.summary: Sprites are sorted by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths. You may combine SortDepthFrontToBack with SortTexture to sort first by depth, and second by texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortTexture
member.summary: Sort sprites by texture prior to drawing. This can improve performance when drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth. You may also combine SortTexture with either SortDepthFrontToBack or SortDepthBackToFront. This will sort the list of sprites by depth first and texture second.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.AlphaBlend
member.summary: Enables alpha blending with RenderState.AlphaTestEnable set to true (for nonzero alpha). Blend.SourceAlpha will be the source blend state, and Blend.InverseSourceAlpha will be the destination blend state in calls to Device.SetRenderState. Font expects this flag to be set when drawing text.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.Billboard
member.summary: Each sprite will be rotated about its center so that it is facing the viewer. Sprite.SetWorldViewLH or Sprite.SetWorldViewRH must be called first.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.ObjectSpace
member.summary: The world, view, and projection transforms are not modified. The transforms currently set to the device are used to transform the sprites when the batched sprites are drawn (when Sprite.Flush or Sprite.End is called). If this flag is not specified, then world, view, and projection transforms are modified so that sprites are drawn in screen-space coordinates.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotModifyRenderState
member.summary: The device render state is not to be changed when Sprite.Begin is called. The device is assumed to be in a valid state to draw vertices containing UsageIndex = 0 in the DeclarationUsage.Position, DeclarationUsage.TexCoord, and DeclarationUsage.Color data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotSaveState
member.summary: The device state is not to be saved or restored when Sprite.Begin or Sprite.End is called.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags
member.summary: Flags used for parsing, compiling, or assembling shaders.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.UseLegacyD3DX9_31Dll
member.summary: Enable the use of the original Direct3D 9 HLSL compiler. OCT2006_d3dx9_31_x86.cab or OCT2006_d3dx9_31_x64.cab must be included as part of the applications redist. This flag is required to compile ps_1_x shaders without using the promotion flag to ps_2_0. Specifying this flag when obtaining an EffectCompiler interface causes subsequent calls to EffectCompiler.CompileEffect and EffectCompiler/CompileShader through this object to use the legacy compiler.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.SkipOptimization
member.summary: Do not validate the generated code against known capabilities and constraints. This option is recommended only when compiling shaders that are known to work (that is, shaders that have compiled before without this option). Shaders are always validated by the runtime before they are set to the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Instruct the compiler to skip optimization steps during code generation. Unless you are trying to isolate a problem in your code and you suspect the compiler, using this option is not recommended.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PreferFlowControl
member.summary: This is a hint to the compiler to prefer using flow-control instructions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PartialPrecision
member.summary: Force all computations in the resulting shader to occur at partial precision This may result in faster evaluation of shaders on some hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel3
member.summary: Highest optimization level. Will produce best possible code but may take significantly longer to do so. This will be useful for final builds of an application where performance is the most important factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel2
member.summary: Second highest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel1
member.summary: Second lowest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel0
member.summary: Lowest optimization level. May produce slower code but will do so more quickly. This may be useful in a highly iterative shader development cycle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.NoPreshader
member.summary: Disables preshaders. The compiler will not pull out static expressions for evaluation on the host CPU. Additionally, the compiler will not loft any expressions when compiling stand-alone functions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.IeeeStrictness
member.summary: Disable optimizations that may cause the output of a compiled shader program to differ from the output of a program compiled with the DirectX 9 shader compiler due to small precision erros in floating point math.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.ForceVSSoftwareNoOpt
member.summary: Force the compiler to compile against the next highest available software target for vertex shaders. This flag also turns optimizations off and debugging on.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.ForcePSSoftwareNoOpt
member.summary: Force the compiler to compile against the next highest available software target for pixel shaders. This flag also turns optimizations off and debugging on.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.EnableBackwardsCompatibility
member.summary: Compile ps_1_x shaders as ps_2_0. Effects that specify ps_1_x targets will instead compile to ps_2_0 targets because this is the minimum shader version supported by the DirectX 10 shader compiler. This flag has no effect when used with higher level compile targets.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.Debug
member.summary: Insert debug filename, line numbers, and type and symbol information during shader compile.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.AvoidFlowControl
member.summary: This is a hint to the compiler to avoid using flow-control instructions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixRowMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in row-major order (each vector will be in a single row) when passed to or from the shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixColumnMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in column-major order (each vector will be in a single column) when passed to and from the shader. This is generally more efficient because it allows vector-matrix multiplication to be performed using a series of dot products.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.summary: Parameter is a Boolean. Any non-zero value passed into ConstantTable.SetBool, ConstantTable.SetBoolArray, ConstantTable.SetValue, ConstantTable.SetVector, or ConstantTable.SetVectorArray will be mapped to 1 (true) before being written into the constant table; otherwise, the value will be set to 0 in the constant table.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags
member.summary: Normal maps generation constants.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.ComputeOcclusion
member.summary: Computes the per-pixel occlusion term and encodes it into the alpha. An alpha of 1 means that the pixel is not obscured in any way, and an alpha of 0 means that the pixel is completely obscured.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.InvertSign
member.summary: Inverts the direction of each normal.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.Mirror
member.summary: Same as specifying the MirrorU and MirrorV flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.MirrorV
member.summary: Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.MirrorU
member.summary: Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshSimplification
member.summary: Specifies simplification options for a mesh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshSimplification.Face
member.summary: The mesh will be simplified by the number of faces specified in the MinValue parameter.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshSimplification.Vertex
member.summary: The mesh will be simplified by the number of vertices specified in the MinValue parameter.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags
member.summary: Specifies the type of mesh optimization to be performed.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.DeviceIndependent
member.summary: Affects the vertex cache size. Using this flag specifies a default vertex cache size that works well on legacy hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: While attribute sorting, do not split vertices that are shared between attribute groups.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.IgnoreVertices
member.summary: Optimize the faces only; do not optimize the vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.StripReorder
member.summary: Reorders faces to maximize length of adjacent triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.VertexCache
member.summary: Reorders faces to increase the cache hit rate of vertex caches.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.AttributeSort
member.summary: Reorders faces to optimize for fewer attribute bundle state changes and enhanced BaseMesh.DrawSubset performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.Compact
member.summary: Reorders faces to remove unused vertices and faces.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags
member.summary: Flags used to specify creation options for a mesh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.Software
member.summary: Equivalent to specifying both D3DXMESH_VB_SOFTWAREPROCESSING and D3DXMESH_IB_SOFTWAREPROCESSING.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.Dynamic
member.summary: Equivalent to specifying both D3DXMESH_VB_DYNAMIC and D3DXMESH_IB_DYNAMIC.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.WriteOnly
member.summary: Equivalent to specifying both VertexBufferDynamic and IndexBufferDynamic.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.Managed
member.summary: Equivalent to specifying both VertexBufferManaged and IndexBufferManaged.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.SystemMemory
member.summary: Equivalent to specifying both VertexBufferSystemMemory and IndexBufferSystemMemory.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.UseHardwareOnly
member.summary: Use hardware processing only. For mixed-mode device, this flag will cause the system to use hardware (if supported in hardware) or will default to software processing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.VertexBufferShare
member.summary: Forces the cloned meshes to share vertex buffers.

member.summary: Use the SoftwareProcessing usage flag for index buffers.

member.summary: Use the Managed usage flag for vertex buffers.

member.summary: Use the SystemMemory usage flag for vertex buffers.

member.summary: Specifying this flag causes the vertex and index buffer of the mesh to be created with the NPatches flag. This is required if the mesh object is to be rendered using N-patch enhancement using Direct3D.

member.summary: Use the DoNotClip usage flag for vertex and index buffers.

member.summary: The mesh has 32-bit indices instead of 16-bit indices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.FX.DoNotSaveSamplerState
member.summary: A stateblock saves state (except shaders and shader constants) when calling Effect.Begin and restores state when calling Effect.End.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.FX.DoNotSaveShaderState
member.summary: A stateblock saves state when calling Effect.Begin and restores state when calling Effect.End.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.FX.DoNotSaveState
member.summary: No state is saved when calling Effect.Begin or restored when calling Effect.End.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.FX.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter
member.summary: Flags used to specify what filters to use when processing an image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.SrgbOut
member.summary: The output data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.SrgbIn
member.summary: Input data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Srgb
member.summary: Specifying this flag is the same as specifying the SrgbIn and SrgbOut flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Dither
member.summary: The resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered dither algorithm.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Mirror
member.summary: Specifying this flag is the same as specifying the MirrorU, MirrorV, and MirrorW flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorW
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the w-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with mipmaps.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Triangle
member.summary: Every pixel in the source image contributes equally to the destination image. This is the slowest of the filters.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Linear
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the four nearest pixels from the source image. This filter works best when the scale on both axes is less than two.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.None
member.summary: No scaling or filtering will take place. Pixels outside the bounds of the source image are assumed to be transparent black.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Default
member.summary: Uses the default behavior.

member.summary: The data type is a DWORD.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType
member.summary: Defines operations to perform on vertices in preparation for mesh cleaning.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Simplification
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during mesh simplification operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Optimization
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during mesh optimization operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Skinning
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during skinning setup mesh operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Bowties
member.summary: If a vertex is the apex of two triangle fans (a bowtie) and mesh operations will affect one of the fans, then split the shared vertex into two new vertices. Bowties can cause problems for operations such as mesh simplification that remove vertices, because removing one vertex affects two distinct sets of triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.BackFacing
member.summary: Merge triangles that share the same vertex indices but have face normals pointing in opposite directions (back-facing triangles). Unless the triangles are not split by adding a replicated vertex, mesh adjacency data from the two triangles may conflict.

member.param: Start color.
End color.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two colors.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. color1 + (color2 - color1) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.summary: Inverts the direction of each normal.

member.summary: Same as specifying the MirrorU and MirrorV flags.

member.summary: Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.NormalMapFlags.MirrorU
member.summary: Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags
member.summary: Values that indicate how to alter mesh data during an optimization operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.DeviceIndependent
member.summary: Affects the vertex cache size. Using this flag specifies a default vertex cache size that works well on legacy hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: While attribute sorting, do not split vertices that are shared between attribute groups.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.IgnoreVertices
member.summary: Optimize the faces only; do not optimize the vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.StripReorder
member.summary: Reorders faces to maximize length of adjacent triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.VertexCache
member.summary: Reorders faces to increase the cache hit rate of vertex caches.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.AttributeSort
member.summary: Reorders faces to optimize for fewer attribute bundle state changes and enhanced draw performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.Compact
member.summary: Reorders faces to remove unused vertices and faces.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshDiscardFlags

member.summary: Indicates that the point representation buffer should be discarded.

member.summary: Indicates that the attribute table should be discarded.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapFlags

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapFlags.DoNotWait
member.summary: Do not wait for the resource to become available. The map method will return WasStillRendering when the GPU blocks the CPU from accessing a resource.

member.summary: Wait for the resource to become available.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode
member.summary: Identifies a resource to be accessed for reading and writing by the CPU.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode.WriteNoOverwrite
member.summary: Resource is mapped for writing; the existing contents of the resource cannot be overwritten. This flag is only valid on vertex and index buffers. The resource must have been created with write access.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode.WriteDiscard
member.summary: Resource is mapped for writing; the previous contents of the resource will be undefined. The resource must have been created with write access.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: Resource is mapped for reading and writing. The resource must have been created with read and write access.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode.Write
member.summary: Resource is mapped for writing. The resource must have been created with write access.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MapMode.Read
member.summary: Resource is mapped for reading. The resource must have been created with read access.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.ImageFileFormat.Dds
member.summary: DirectDraw surface (DDS) file format. Stores textures, volume textures, and cubic environment maps, with or without mipmap levels, and with or without pixel compression.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.ImageFileFormat.Png
member.summary: Portable Network Graphics (PNG) file format. A non-proprietary bitmap format using lossless compression.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.ImageFileFormat.Jpg
member.summary: Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) compressed file format. Specifies variable compression of 24-bit RGB color and 8-bit gray-scale Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) image document files.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.ImageFileFormat.Bmp
member.summary: Windows bitmap (BMP) file format. Contains a header that describes the resolution of the device on which the rectangle of pixels was created, the dimensions of the rectangle, the size of the array of bits, a logical palette, and an array of bits that defines the relationship between pixels in the bitmapped image and entries in the logical palette.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags
member.summary: Specifies possible texture filtering flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.StandardRgb
member.summary: Combines the StandardRgbIn and StandardRgbOut flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.StandardRgbOut
member.summary: Output data is in standard RGB (sRGB) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.StandardRgbIn
member.summary: Input data is in standard RGB (sRGB) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.DitherDiffusion
member.summary: Do diffuse dithering on the image when changing from one format to another.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Dither
member.summary: The resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered dither algorithm. This happens when converting from one format to another.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Mirror
member.summary: Combines the MirrorU, MirrorV, and MirrorW flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.MirrowW
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the w-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with mipmaps.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Triangle
member.summary: Every pixel in the source image contributes equally to the destination image. This is the slowest of the filters.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Linear
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the four nearest pixels from the source image. This filter works best when the scale on both axes is less than two.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.FilterFlags.None
member.summary: No scaling or filtering will take place. Pixels outside the bounds of the source image are assumed to be transparent black.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.Filter
member.summary: Specifies filtering options used during texture sampling.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.Filter.Texture1Bit
member.summary: For use with pixel shaders utilizing textures in the R1_UNorm format.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption
member.summary: Blend options. A blend option identifies the data source and an optional pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseSecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The sources are both alpha (A) outputs from a pixel shader. There is an inverting pre-blend (1 - A). This option allows for dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.SecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The sources are both alpha (A) outputs from a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend. This option allows for dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseSecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The sources are both color (RGB) outputs from a pixel shader. There is an inverting pre-blend (1 - RGB). This option allows for dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.SecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The sources are both color (RGB) outputs from a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This option allows for dual-source blending.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseBlendFactor
member.summary: The source is the blend factor (F) from the current blend state with an inverting pre-blend (1 - F).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.BlendFactor
member.summary: The source is the blend factor (F) from the current blend state with no pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.SourceAlphaSaturate
member.summary: The source is the alpha (A) from a render target with a saturation pre-blend (clamping to 1 or less).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseDestinationColor
member.summary: The source is the color (RGB) from a rendertarget with an inverting pre-blend (1 - A).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.DestinationColor
member.summary: The source is the color (RGB) from a rendertarget with no pre-blend.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseDestinationAlpha
member.summary: The source is the alpha (A) from a rendertarget with an inverting pre-blend (1 - A).

member.summary: The source is the alpha (A) from a rendertarget with no pre-blend.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseSourceAlpha
member.summary: The source is the alpha (A) from a pixel shader with an inverting pre-blend (1 - A).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.SourceAlpha
member.summary: The source is the alpha (A) from a pixel shader with no pre-blend.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.BlendOption.InverseSourceColor
member.summary: The source is the color (RGB) from a pixel shader with an inverting pre-blend (1 - RGB).

member.summary: The source is the color (RGB) from a pixel shader with no pre-blend.

member.summary: The source is the color (1,1,1,1) with no pre-blend.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D10.AsynchronousFlags
member.summary: Optional flags that control the behavior of Asynchronous.GetData.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.AsynchronousFlags.DoNotFlush
member.summary: Indicates the command buffer should not be flushed. Note that this can cause an infinite loop if GetData() is called repeatedly until returning successfully: there may still be commands in the buffer than need to be processed in order for GetData() to return successfully. Since the buffer will not be flushed, those commands will not be processed and GetData() will never return successfully.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.AsynchronousFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates no specific behavior.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.DetectDoubleDispose
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX detects double disposal of objects. If set to true, SlimDX will throw an when an already disposed object is disposed. If set to false, double disposals will be silently ignored. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.ThrowOnShaderCompileError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX defaults to throwing exceptions when a shader or effect compilation fails. The default value is true.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.ThrowOnError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX defaults to throwing exceptions on result codes that indicate errors. The default value is true.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.EnableObjectTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX is currently tracking call stacks from object creation. If set to false, objects will not carry a call stack from when they were created. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Object tracking is a useful debugging facility, but may have a significant negative impact on performance. The default value is false.
